contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=March 2013}} '''Bob Kerr's Whoopee Band''', also billed as '''Bob Kerr and His Whoopee Band''', is a [[jazz band]] which started in 1967 and continues to perform today. It was an offshoot of the eclectic [[Bonzo Dog Doo-Dah Band]], and shared many similarities with other outfits of the time such as [[The New Vaudeville Band]] and [[The Temperance Seven]]. Kerr was a member of both the Bonzos and the New Vaudeville Band. The band's publicity manager was originally [[Laurie Bamford]] the well-known [[Numismatist]] who died in 2005. Several former members formed [[Bill Posters Will Be Band]] in 1983. Current{{When|date=September 2011}} members of Bob Kerr's Whoopee Band are [[Bob Kerr (musician)|Bob Kerr]], John "The Professor" Percival, Malcolm Sked, Bert Lamb and Henri Harrison. ==Former members== Former members of the band have included: *Vernon Dudley Bowhay-Nowell *Ian Howarth *Frankie Tomes *Sam Spoons *Hugh Crozier *Evil John Gieves Watson *Biff Harrison *Jim "Golden Boots" Chambers *David "Mr Piano" Glasson *[[Sean Moyses]] *Dangerous Dave Keech *Spike Botterill *Henry Davis *Clive Fenton *Tim Phillips *Fred Ward *Sir Alan Buckley *Phil Buckley *Richard White *Dave Turner *Roscoe (The Binman) Birchmore *Graham Collicott ==External links== * [http://www.whoopeeband.de/ Official site] * [http://www.doodahdiaries.com David Christie's Doo Dah Diaries] [[Category:British jazz ensembles]]
